Package src.main.persistence.classes

Class DocumentManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.main.persistence.classes.DocumentManager
  • public class DocumentManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the Document Manager, it is responsible for loading and saving the documents.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      DocumentManager()
      Constructor of the Document Manager.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      void deleteDocument​(java.lang.String name)
      Function to erase a document.
      java.lang.Object loadDocument​(java.lang.String name)
      This function returns the document located in the path ending with name name.
      void saveDocument​(java.lang.Object document, java.lang.String name)
      This function either saves the document or modifies it if its already been saved previously.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DocumentManager

        public DocumentManager()
        Constructor of the Document Manager.

    • Method Detail

      • saveDocument

        public void saveDocument​(java.lang.Object document,
                         java.lang.String name)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This function either saves the document or modifies it if its already been saved previously.
        Parameters:
        document - Document to be saved.
        name - The name of the binary that stores the document (by precondition the name will always be the concatenation of its title and author).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the object can't be saved, this exception is thrown.

      • loadDocument

        public java.lang.Object loadDocument​(java.lang.String name)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        This function returns the document located in the path ending with name name.
        Parameters:
        name - The name will be used in order to find the path where its located (if the document exists then its location ends with the concatenation of its title and author).
        Returns:
        The document is returned as an Object type.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the object can't be found, this excepction is thrown.

      • deleteDocument

        public void deleteDocument​(java.lang.String name)
        Function to erase a document.
        Parameters:
        name - The name will be used in order to find the path where its located (if the document exists then its location ends with the concatenation of its title and author).
